titleInfo.title: Thermal hadron production in Si-Au collisions

mods.abstract: The most abundantly produced hadron species in Si-Au collisions at the BNL-AGS (nucleons, pions, kaons, antikaons and hyperons) are shown to be in accord with emission from a thermal resonance gas source. Within the uncertainties of the present data, two freeze-out points are possible. The best agreement is obtained for a temperature T similar or equal to 110 MeV and a baryochemical potential mu(B) similar or equal to 540 MeV, corresponding to about 1/3 standard nuclear density. Another possible point lies at about twice nuclear density, with T similar or equal to 110 MeV and mu(B) similar or equal to 620 MeV. Our analysis takes the isopin asymmetry of the initial state fully into account.

titleInfo.title: ZEITSCHRIFT FUR PHYSIK C-PARTICLES AND FIELDS
